author: P V
text:
In a case of suspected honour killing, a 20-year-old youth was lynched by the family members of a girl with whom he was romantically involved in Kumbalapuram in Denkanikottai.

The victim, R.Shekar of Marekavundanapalli village in Denkanikottai, was allegedly beaten up by the parents and the brother of the 17-year-old girl near her house. The youth succumbed to the injuries soon. The girl and the youth are from the same community.

According to sources, Shekar and the girl met recently at her brother’s wedding, and had stayed in touch over phone. The girl’s father Billappa, mother Jayamma and her 21-year-old brother Osakottappa on coming to know of the friendship wanted to put an end to it.

On Monday evening, the girl was made to summon Shekar to her place. According to the police, Shekar was confronted by the family members. The youth was allegedly tied up to a tree and beaten up before he fainted. Jayamma then called up Shekar’s father, Rajappa, and told him that his son had come to their place to create trouble.

Rajappa’s family members rushed him to the nearest hospital in Anekal in Karnataka, from where he was referred to a private hospital in Bengaluru. Shekar was declared brought dead on Monday night.

Based on a complaint by Rajappa with Thally police station, a case of murder was registered against Billappa, Jayamma and Osakottappa.

SP R.Thirunavukkarasu said that Billappa had been arrested, and the other two were absconding.
title: Teenager lynched to death by girl’s family
